feed.title: Google Cloud: Dataproc
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Dataproc

entry.content: Fixed the spark.driver.extraClassPath delimiter for the Jupyter SparkMonitor Listener.
entry.summary: The delimiter for `spark.driver.extraClassPath` has been corrected for the Jupyter SparkMonitor Listener. This fix ensures proper configuration and functionality of the listener.
entry.title: Fixed: Spark driver classpath delimiter fixed

entry.content: Added a new dataproc:pypi.repository property to customize the PyPI repository used for pip. The value can be a URL, or google to use a Google-hosted cache of PyPI, accessible without public internet connectivity. Starting in image version 3.1, google will be the default; to opt out and return to public PyPI, use the value pypi.
entry.summary: A new property allows you to specify a custom PyPI repository for pip installations on Dataproc. You can use a URL or 'google' for a cached, offline-accessible repository. The 'google' option becomes the default in image version 3.1.
entry.title: Feature: Customize PyPI Repository for Pip

entry.content:
New Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions:

  • 2.0.158-debian10, 2.0.158-ubuntu18, 2.0.158-rocky8
  • 2.1.107-debian11, 2.1.107-ubuntu20, 2.1.107-ubuntu20-arm, 2.1.107-rocky8
  • 2.2.75-debian12, 2.2.75-ubuntu22, 2.2.75-ubuntu22-arm, 2.2.75-rocky9
  • 2.3.22-debian12, 2.3.22-ml-ubuntu22, 2.3.22-rocky9, 2.3.22-ubuntu22, 2.3.22-ubuntu22-arm
entry.summary: New subminor image versions for Dataproc on Compute Engine are now available. These updates include support for various operating systems like Debian, Ubuntu, and Rocky Linux across different Dataproc versions. This allows users to leverage the latest software components and security patches for their big data workloads.
entry.title: Announcement: New Dataproc image versions available

entry.content: Parquet CLI version upgraded to 1.15.2 in 2.1 and 2.2 images.
entry.summary: Parquet CLI has been upgraded to version 1.15.2. This update is now available in the 2.1 and 2.2 images. This ensures you have the latest features and improvements for Parquet processing.
entry.title: Feature: Parquet CLI Updated

entry.content: Fixed a bug in the ARM image that prevented connecting to a Dataproc Metastore instance with a gRPC protocol endpoint.
entry.summary: A bug in the ARM image that caused issues connecting to Dataproc Metastore instances via gRPC has been fixed. This resolves the connectivity problem, ensuring smoother operation.
entry.title: Fixed: Dataproc Metastore connection issue resolved

entry.content: Apache Pig is now available in ARM images.
entry.summary: Apache Pig is now available in ARM images. This update expands compatibility and performance options for users.
entry.title: Feature: Apache Pig on ARM

entry.content: Delta subminor version upgraded to 3.2.1 in Dataproc on Compute Engine image 2.2 and 2.3.
entry.summary: Dataproc images 2.2 and 2.3 now include an upgraded Delta subminor version to 3.2.1. This update enhances performance and stability for your data processing workloads.
entry.title: Feature: Dataproc Delta Subminor Version Upgrade

entry.content: Removed use of deprecated Hadoop configuration properties fs.default.name and yarn.resourcemanager.system-metrics-publisher.enabled.
entry.summary: Deprecated Hadoop configuration properties `fs.default.name` and `yarn.resourcemanager.system-metrics-publisher.enabled` have been removed. This change ensures compatibility with updated Hadoop versions and improves system stability. Users should verify their configurations to avoid potential issues.
entry.title: Change: Hadoop Configuration Update

entry.content: Upcoming Spark data lineage changes See the upcoming May, 2026 Dataproc and Serverless for Apache Spark release notes for an announcement of a change that will automatically enable Dataproc Spark data lineage and Serverless for Apache Spark data lineage when you enable the Data Lineage API (see Control lineage ingestion for a service) without requiring additional project, cluster, batch workload, or interactive session settings.
entry.summary: Dataproc and Serverless for Apache Spark will automatically enable data lineage in May 2026 upon enabling the Data Lineage API. This change simplifies setup by removing the need for additional project, cluster, or workload configurations. Users can find more details in the upcoming release notes.
entry.title: Announcement: Spark data lineage changes coming May 2026

entry.content:
New Serverless for Apache Spark runtime versions:

  • 3.0.4
entry.summary: New serverless runtime versions for Apache Spark are now available. This update includes version 3.0.4, providing enhanced features and performance for your Spark workloads.
entry.title: Announcement: New Apache Spark runtime versions

entry.content:
Dataproc on Compute Engine: The following subminor image versions announced on January 24, 2026 have been rolled back:

  • 2.0.157-debian10, 2.0.157-ubuntu18, 2.0.157-rocky8
  • 2.1.106-debian11, 2.1.106-ubuntu20, 2.1.106-ubuntu20-arm, 2.1.106-rocky8
  • 2.2.74-debian12, 2.2.74-ubuntu22, 2.2.74-ubuntu22-arm, 2.2.74-rocky9
  • 2.3.21-debian12, 2.3.21-ml-ubuntu22, 2.3.21-rocky9, 2.3.21-ubuntu22, 2.3.21-ubuntu22-arm
entry.summary: Certain Dataproc on Compute Engine image versions released on January 24, 2026 have been rolled back due to issues. Users are advised to check the release notes for specific version details and potential impact.
entry.title: Announcement: Dataproc image versions rolled back

entry.content: Upgraded the Delta subminor version to 3.2.1 in images 2.2 and 2.3.
entry.summary: The Delta runtime has been updated to version 3.2.1 in images 2.2 and 2.3. This update includes the latest improvements and bug fixes for the Delta runtime.
entry.title: Feature: Delta Runtime Updated

entry.content: Fixed a bug in the ARM image that prevented connecting to a Dataproc Metastore instance with a gRPC protocol endpoint.
entry.summary: Resolved an issue where the ARM image prevented connections to Dataproc Metastore instances using gRPC. This fix ensures proper connectivity for gRPC protocol endpoints.
entry.title: Fixed: Dataproc Metastore gRPC connection fix

entry.content: Fixed the spark.driver.extraClassPath delimiter for the Jupyter SparkMonitor Listener.
entry.summary: The delimiter for the spark.driver.extraClassPath has been corrected for the Jupyter SparkMonitor Listener. This ensures proper functionality and configuration of the listener.
entry.title: Fixed: Spark Monitor Listener Classpath Fix

entry.content:
New Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions:

  • 2.0.157-debian10, 2.0.157-ubuntu18, 2.0.157-rocky8
  • 2.1.106-debian11, 2.1.106-ubuntu20, 2.1.106-ubuntu20-arm, 2.1.106-rocky8
  • 2.2.74-debian12, 2.2.74-ubuntu22, 2.2.74-ubuntu22-arm, 2.2.74-rocky9
  • 2.3.21-debian12, 2.3.21-ml-ubuntu22, 2.3.21-rocky9, 2.3.21-ubuntu22, 2.3.21-ubuntu22-arm

Rollback Notice: These image versions were rolled back on January 30, 2026.
entry.summary: New image versions for Dataproc on Compute Engine are now available, offering updated components and support for various operating systems. These versions include enhancements for different distributions like Debian, Ubuntu, and Rocky Linux. Note: These image versions were rolled back on January 30, 2026.
entry.title: Announcement: New Dataproc image versions available

entry.content: Added a new dataproc:pypi.repository property to customize the PyPI repository that pip uses. The value can be a internet-accessible URL, or you can specify google to use a Google-hosted cache of PyPI, which is accessible without public internet connectivity. Starting with Dataproc image version 3.1, google will be the default (you can specify the pypi property value to use public PyPI instead of the default google 3.1 value).
entry.summary: You can now customize the PyPI repository used by pip in Dataproc with the new `dataproc:pypi.repository` property. This allows you to specify a custom URL or use a Google-hosted cache for offline access. Starting with image version 3.1, the Google-hosted cache is the default.
entry.title: Feature: Customize PyPI Repository for Dataproc

entry.content: Apache Pig is now available in ARM images.
entry.summary: Apache Pig is now available in ARM images. This update expands the compatibility of Apache Pig for users working with ARM-based architectures.
entry.title: Feature: Apache Pig on ARM

entry.content: Removed the use of deprecated Hadoop configuration properties fs.default.name and yarn.resourcemanager.system-metrics-publisher.enabled.
entry.summary: Deprecated Hadoop configuration properties related to file system and resource management have been removed. This update ensures compatibility with current Hadoop standards and improves system stability.
entry.title: Change: Hadoop configuration updated

entry.content: • Applied patch for SPARK-48292 in Serverless for Apache Spark 1.2 and 2.2 runtimes.
entry.summary: A fix for SPARK-48292 has been applied to Serverless for Apache Spark runtimes 1.2 and 2.2. This resolves an issue within the Spark environment.
entry.title: Fixed: Spark Runtime Fix

entry.content:
New Serverless for Apache Spark runtime versions:

  • 1.2.67
  • 2.2.67
  • 2.3.20
  • 3.0.3
entry.summary: We're excited to announce the release of new Serverless for Apache Spark runtime versions, including 1.2.67, 2.2.67, 2.3.20, and 3.0.3. These updates provide the latest features and performance improvements for your Spark workloads.
entry.title: Announcement: New Apache Spark runtimes available

entry.title: Announcement: New Spark Runtime Versions Available

entry.content: Removed use of deprecated Hadoop configuration properties fs.default.name and yarn.resourcemanager.system-metrics-publisher.enabled.
entry.summary: We have removed the use of deprecated Hadoop configuration properties, specifically `fs.default.name` and `yarn.resourcemanager.system-metrics-publisher.enabled`. This change ensures we are using current and supported configurations.
entry.title: Change: Deprecated Hadoop properties removed

entry.content:
New Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions:

  • 2.0.156-debian10, 2.0.156-ubuntu18, 2.0.156-rocky8
  • 2.1.105-debian11, 2.1.105-ubuntu20, 2.1.105-ubuntu20-arm, 2.1.105-rocky8

Rollback Notice: These image versions were rolled back on January 13, 2026.
entry.summary: New image versions for Dataproc on Compute Engine are now available, offering updated components and features. These updates include various Debian, Ubuntu, and Rocky Linux distributions across multiple Dataproc versions. Please note that these specific image versions were rolled back on January 13, 2026.
entry.title: Announcement: Dataproc image version updates

entry.content: Fixed the spark.driver.extraClassPath delimiter for the Jupyter SparkMonitor Listener.
entry.summary: Resolved an issue with the Spark Monitor Listener's `spark.driver.extraClassPath` delimiter. This correction ensures proper functionality for users employing this feature.
entry.title: Fixed: Spark Monitor Listener Fix

entry.content: Added a new property dataproc:pypi.repository to customize the PyPI repository used for pip. The value can be a URL, or google to use a Google-hosted cache of PyPI, accessible without public internet connectivity. Starting in image version 3.1, google will be the default; to opt out and return to public PyPI, use the value pypi.
entry.summary: You can now specify a custom PyPI repository URL or use a Google-hosted cache for pip installations. Starting with image version 3.1, the Google-hosted cache is the default. To revert to the public PyPI, set the value to `pypi`.
entry.title: Feature: Customize PyPI Repository for Pip

entry.content:
New Serverless for Apache Spark runtime versions:

  • 2.2.65

entry.title: Announcement: New serverless Spark versions available

entry.content:
The following Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions, released on December 05, 2025, are now blocklisted:

entry.summary: New subminor image versions for Dataproc on Compute Engine are now available, offering expanded options for your big data workloads. Note that certain versions within the 2.2 and 2.3 releases have been blocklisted.
entry.title: Announcement: New Dataproc image versions available

entry.content:
Serverless for Apache Spark: Runtime version 3.0 is now generally available. This version simplifies onboarding, improves reliability, reduces startup latency, and adds support for Spark 4.0.

  • Features and improvements:

  • Regional and multi-zonal workloads are used by default to increase obtainability of compute resources

  • Faster startup than previous runtimes
  • Fast resource cleanup that allows faster release of VPC IPs after workload completion
  • End-user credentials are used for all workloads by default
  • New bigquery Spark catalog, pre-configured for out-of-the-box BigQuery native table interactions
  • New Spark Serverless-specific IAM roles
  • New dataproc-rm.googleapis.com API enablement is required
entry.summary: Serverless for Apache Spark version 3.0 is now generally available, offering improved reliability, faster startup times, and support for Spark 4.0. This new version simplifies onboarding and enhances resource management.
entry.title: Announcement: Apache Spark 3.0 Now Available

entry.content:
Dataproc on Compute Engine: Updated Cloud Storage connector:

  • Updated to 3.1.10 in image version 2.3.18.
  • Updated to 3.0.15 in image version 2.2.71.
  • Updated to hadoop3-2.2.30 in image versions 2.1.103 and 2.0.154.
entry.summary: The Cloud Storage connector for Dataproc on Compute Engine has been updated across several image versions, including 2.3.18, 2.2.71, 2.1.103, and 2.0.154, with specific version changes for each. This update ensures improved performance and compatibility.
entry.title: Change: Dataproc Connector Update

entry.content: Serverless for Apache Spark: Added the dataproc.artifacts.remove property, which lets users remove default artifacts, such as spark-bigquery-connector, iceberg, and delta-lake from a Serverless for Apache Spark runtime.
entry.summary: You can now remove default artifacts like the Spark BigQuery connector from your Serverless for Apache Spark runtimes using the new dataproc.artifacts.remove property.
entry.title: Feature: Remove default artifacts from Spark Serverless

entry.content: Serverless for Apache Spark: Apache Spark upgrade to version 3.5.3 for the 1.2 and 2.2 Serverless for Apache Spark runtime versions announced on October 13, 2025 has been rolled back.
entry.summary: The recent upgrade of Serverless for Apache Spark to version 3.5.3 has been rolled back for runtime versions 1.2 and 2.2. This change was announced on October 13, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Serverless for Apache Spark Upgrade

entry.content: Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image version 2.3.16, announced on October 20, 2025 has been blocklisted and cannot be used when creating a new cluster.
entry.summary: The Dataproc on Compute Engine image version 2.3.16 has been blocklisted and cannot be used for new clusters.
entry.title: Breaking: Dataproc image version blocklisted

entry.content: Fixed a Jupyter Kernel Gateway bug that caused failures while restarting kernels.
entry.summary: The issue that caused failures while restarting Jupyter Kernel Gateway has been resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Kernels Restarting Fixed

entry.content:
New Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions:

  • 2.0.153-debian10, 2.0.153-ubuntu18, 2.0.153-rocky8
  • 2.1.102-debian11, 2.1.102-ubuntu20, 2.1.102-ubuntu20-arm, 2.1.102-rocky8
  • 2.2.70-debian12, 2.2.70-ubuntu22, 2.2.70-ubuntu22-arm, 2.2.70-rocky9

entry.summary: New image versions for Dataproc on Compute Engine have been released, including updates for 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, and 2.3 series. These updates provide the latest features and security patches for your data processing workloads.
entry.title: Announcement: New Dataproc image versions available

entry.content:
Announcing the General Availability (GA) of Lightning Engine for Google Cloud Serverless for Apache Spark. Lightning Engine is a high-performance query accelerator that delivers up to 4.3x faster performance for Spark workloads compared to open-source Spark, as measured on TPC-H-like benchmarks.

For more details on enabling Lightning Engine and its advanced features like Native Query Execution (NQE), see the official documentation.
entry.summary: Lightning Engine for Apache Spark is now generally available, offering significant performance improvements for Spark workloads.
entry.title: Announcement: Lightning Engine for Apache Spark is now generally available

entry.content:
Serverless for Apache Spark: With the Lightning Engine GA release, the property to enable Native Query Execution (NQE) feature has been updated.

In order to use Lightning Engine, submit your jobs in the Premium tier. Under Lightning Engine, if you would like to use the NQE feature, set the new flag: spark.dataproc.lightningEngine.runtime=native. Users are encouraged to try this feature to explore the full potential of Lightning Engine.

For backward compatibility, the legacy property that was used to enable NQE spark.dataproc.runtimeEngine=native will continue to be honored in the existing runtimes 1.2, 2.2 and 2.3, but it's not supported in future releases (3.0+ runtimes).
entry.summary: The property to enable the Native Query Execution (NQE) feature for the Serverless for Apache Spark has been updated with the Lightning Engine GA release. To use this feature, submit your jobs in the Premium tier and set the new flag: `spark.dataproc.lightningEngine.runtime=native`.
entry.title: Changed: Native Query Execution (NQE) feature updated

entry.title: Announcement: New Dataproc image versions available

entry.content: Fixed startup race condition in multi-tenant clusters using the dataproc:pip.packages property that could cause authentication failures while starting Jupyter notebook kernels.
entry.summary: The startup race condition in multi-tenant clusters has been fixed. This resolves authentication failures that could occur when starting Jupyter notebook kernels.
entry.title: Fixed: Startup race condition fixed

New Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions:

entry.content: Serverless for Apache Spark: Runtimes rollout with Apache Spark upgrade to version 3.5.3 in the latest 1.2 and 2.2 Serverless for Apache Spark runtime versions has started and is expected to finish by October 16th.
entry.summary: New runtimes with Apache Spark 3.5.3 are rolling out for Serverless for Apache Spark. The upgrade is expected to finish by October 16th.
entry.title: Announcement: Apache Spark Runtimes Rollout

entry.content:
Dataproc on Compute Engine: The following diagnostic properties are now enabled by default for new Dataproc clusters created with 2.0+ image versions:

  • dataproc:diagnostic.capture.enabled: Collects checkpoint diagnostic data in the cluster temp bucket.
  • dataproc:dataproc.logging.extended.enabled: Collects logs for the Knox, Zeppelin, Ranger-usersync, Jupyter_notebook, Jupyter_kernel_gateway components and the Spark History-Server in Cloud Logging.
  • dataproc:dataproc.logging.syslog.enabled: Collects VM syslogs in Cloud Logging.

Note: To disable any of these features, set the corresponding property to false during cluster creation.

To continue using the Ops Agent initialization action opsagent.sh to ingest syslogs from Dataproc cluster nodes, do one of the following:

  • Recommended: Use opsagent_nosyslog.sh since VM syslogs are emitted by default from Dataproc clusters.
  • Set the dataproc:dataproc.logging.syslog.enabled=false and continue using opsagent.sh to ingest syslogs.
entry.summary: New Dataproc clusters (2.0+) now have diagnostic data capture and extended logging enabled by default. This includes checkpoint data, logs for various components and Spark History-Server, and VM syslogs, all of which are sent to Cloud Logging. You can disable these features or adjust the Ops Agent initialization action as needed.
entry.title: Changed: New diagnostic properties enabled for Dataproc clusters

entry.content:
New Serverless for Apache Spark runtime versions:

  • 3.0.0-RC5

entry.content:
New Serverless for Apache Spark runtime versions:

  • 1.2.61
  • 2.2.61

  • 3.0.0-RC4

entry.content: Dataproc on Compute Engine: Sharing checkpoint diagnostic data: Setting the dataproc:diagnostic.capture.access=GOOGLE_DATAPROC_DIAGNOSE property during cluster creation shares all of the temp bucket contents with Google Cloud support if uniform bucket-level access is enabled on temp bucket. If object-level access control is in effect on the temp bucket, only the checkpoint diagnostic data folder corresponding to the cluster in Cloud Storage is shared.
entry.summary: Share checkpoint diagnostic data with Google Cloud support.
entry.title: Feature: Dataproc diagnostic data sharing

The 2.3.7-ml-ubuntu22 image extends the 2.3 base image with ML-specific libraries.
entry.summary: New Dataproc image versions are available, including ML-specific libraries.
entry.title: Announcement: Dataproc Image Updates

entry.content:
Dataproc on Compute Engine: Starting August 18, 2025, the following diagnostic properties will be enabled by default for newly created Dataproc clusters:

  • dataproc:diagnostic.capture.enabled: Enables the collection of checkpoint data in the cluster temp bucket.
  • dataproc:dataproc.logging.extended.enabled: Enables the collection of logs for the Knox, Zeppelin, Ranger-usersync, Jupyter_notebook, Jupyter_kernel_gateway components and the Spark History-Server in Cloud Logging.
  • dataproc:dataproc.logging.syslog.enabled: Enables the collection of VM syslogs in Cloud Logging.

To continue using the Ops Agent initialization action opsagent.sh to ingest syslogs from Dataproc cluster nodes, do one of the following:

  • Recommended: Use opsagent_nosyslog.sh since VM syslogs will now be emitted by default from Dataproc clusters.
  • Set the dataproc:dataproc.logging.syslog.enabled=false and continue using opsagent.sh to ingest syslogs.

Note: To disable any of these features, set the corresponding property to false during cluster creation.
entry.summary: Diagnostic data collection will be enabled by default for new Dataproc clusters starting August 18, 2025. This includes checkpoint data, extended logs for components like Spark History-Server, and VM syslogs in Cloud Logging. If you use the Ops Agent initialization action, consider using `opsagent_nosyslog.sh` or disabling the syslog property to avoid duplicate logs.
entry.title: Announcement: Enhanced Diagnostic Data Collection for Dataproc Clusters

entry.content:
New Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions:

entry.content: Dataproc now allows Dynamic update of multi-tenancy clusters.

entry.content: The Cluster Scheduled Stop feature is available in preview. You can use this feature to stop clusters after a specified idle period, at a specified future time, or after a specified period from the cluster creation or update request.
entry.summary: You can now stop your Dataproc clusters automatically after a specified idle period, at a specific time, or after a certain period from creation or update.
entry.title: Feature: Dataproc Scheduled Stop Feature Now in Preview

entry.content: Serverless for Apache Spark (formerly known as Dataproc Serverless for Spark) now supports OS Login organization policy. Organizations, folders, and projects that enforce the OS Login policy can now use Serverless for Apache Spark.

entry.title: Changed: Serverless for Apache Spark supports OS Login

entry.content: Dataproc on Compute Engine: Dataproc now automatically configures Knox Gateway configuration properties gateway.dispatch.whitelist.services and gateway.dispatch.whitelist for component web UIs within the cluster.
entry.summary: Dataproc on Compute Engine now automatically configures Knox Gateway properties for component web UIs, simplifying cluster management.
entry.title: Changed: Dataproc Auto-configures Knox Gateway

entry.content:
Dataproc on Compute Engine: Fixed a bug in trino-jvm cluster properties. To configure Trino JVM options prefixed with trino-jvm, follow these guidelines:

  • Configure JVM options starting with -XX:, without :. For JVM flags without a value, add = at the end. For example, add trino-jvm:-XX+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError= as -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError in the jvm.config.
  • Specify JVM options system properties with a -D prefix the same way. For example, trino-jvm:-Dsystem.property.name=value.
  • Any value containing : cannot be provided as a cluster property.
entry.summary: A bug in `trino-jvm cluster properties` for Dataproc on Compute Engine has been fixed. The guidelines for configuring Trino JVM options have been updated to ensure proper formatting for JVM flags and system properties.
entry.title: Fixed: Dataproc: Trino JVM properties configuration fixed

entry.content: Dataproc on Compute Engine & Dataproc Serverless: Backported GH-3198 in Parquet addressing CVE-2025-46762.
entry.summary: A security vulnerability in Parquet (CVE-2025-46762) has been fixed and backported for Dataproc on Compute Engine and Dataproc Serverless. This update addresses the identified issue.
entry.title: Fixed: Parquet security vulnerability fixed in Dataproc

entry.content:
Announcing the GA release of Dataproc on Compute Engine image version 2.3:

Image Version 2.3 is a lightweight image that contains only core components, reducing exposure to Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs). For higher security compliance requirements, use the image version 2.3 or later when creating a Dataproc cluster. Optional components can still be deployed on-demand.

The following images are the latest available 2.3 subminor image versions:

  • 2.3.3-debian12, 2.3.3-rocky9, and 2.3.3-ubuntu22

2.3 images include the components listed in 2.3.x release versions.
entry.summary: Google Cloud announces the general availability of Dataproc on Compute Engine image version 2.3. This version is a lightweight image with core components, enhancing security by reducing exposure to CVEs. It is recommended for clusters with high security compliance requirements, and optional components can be deployed as needed. The latest subminor versions available are 2.3.3 with Debian 12, Rocky 9, and Ubuntu 22.
entry.title: Announcement: Dataproc on Compute Engine 2.3 Now Generally Available

entry.content: Dataproc Serverless for Spark: Fixed a bug that prevented the spark.executorEnv property from correctly setting specific executor environment variables across all runtimes.
entry.summary: A bug that affected the setting of specific executor environment variables in Dataproc Serverless for Spark has been resolved. The fix ensures that the `spark.executorEnv` property now functions correctly across all runtimes.
entry.title: Fixed: Dataproc Serverless: Executor environment variable bug fixed

  • Image version 2.1: Supported until 03/31/2026
  • Image version 2.0 Supported until 09/30/2025
entry.summary: The support periods for Dataproc on Compute Engine image versions 2.0, 2.1, and 2.2 have been extended. Version 2.2 is now supported until March 31, 2027, version 2.1 until March 31, 2026, and version 2.0 until September 30, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Dataproc image version support extended

entry.content: Announcing the General Availability release of Spark on BigQuery, which lets you create a serverless Spark session in a BigQuery Studio notebook. Use this feature to create, run, and test Spark jobs quickly and easily. For more information, see Run PySpark code in BigQuery Studio notebooks.
entry.summary: We are excited to announce the general availability of Spark on BigQuery. This new feature allows you to create and run serverless Spark sessions directly within BigQuery Studio notebooks, making it easier than ever to develop and test your Spark jobs.
entry.title: Announcement: Spark on BigQuery Now Generally Available
